sentence.Network_en: The train ran into a snowdrift.
Two huge , hairy ears stuck up above the snowdrift.

in the severe winter of 1947 , farmers had to dig their livestock out of huge snowdrifts .在1947年严峻的冬天，农民们不得不挖开大雪堆把他们的家畜救出来。

entry.def: A snowdrift is a deep pile of snow formed by the wind.

means.word_mean: 1. a mass of snow heaped up by the wind
